angels.name: Marquell
angels.story: Meet Marquell, Aggies for Limbs very first recipient! We were so happy to be able to help bring Marquell back on his feet after 5 months of being unable to walk. When given the opportunity to walk again he took full strides with no hesitation. Seeing his determination brought so much joy to our hearts and inspired us to take the same approach in other areas of our own lives. We look forward to hearing about all of the advances he will make in the days to come!

details.Current Status: Able to take full strides, showing determination and joy

angels.name: Santos
angels.story: Meet Santos, Aggies for Limbs third Angel. She was so excited to get her prosthetic that she wanted to sleep in it! Now that Santos has her new prosthetic leg, she is able to get her GED and become a teachers assistant.

details.Current Status: Excited and eager to use new prosthetic, even wanting to sleep in it
details.Goals: Get GED and become a teacher's assistant

angels.name: Peggy
angels.story: We had the pleasure if giving Peggy her prosthetic in early May 2017. Peggy was an above the knee amputee. She is still trying to get used to her new prosthetic. We are very grateful to help Peggy. She has a great attitude and is always joyful.

details.Current Status: Still adjusting to new prosthetic, has a great attitude and joyful demeanor

angels.name: Reuben
angels.story: Introducing our 4th Angel Reuben Martinez. He is 20 years old and hopes to one day go back to school and become a prosthetist. Reuben was so grateful that he wore his new Aggies for Limbs shirt to his appointment!

details.Current Status: Grateful for new prosthetic, wore AFL shirt to appointment
details.Goals: Return to school and become a prosthetist

angels.name: Roman
angels.story: Meet Roman, one of our inspiring Angels! As a double amputee, Roman has shown incredible determination throughout his rehabilitation journey. His positive attitude and dedication during physical therapy sessions, where he practices walking with parallel bars, demonstrates the remarkable resilience of the human spirit. We are honored to be part of his journey and to help him regain his mobility through prosthetic care.

angels.name: Jorge
angels.story: Jorge is our Spring 2019 recipient. He was a double amputee, one above the knee and one below the knee. Due to complications with his amputation, he now has two above the knee amputations. We were able to provide another prosthetic after that surgery during the Fall of 2020.

details.Current Status: Adapting to new prosthetics after complications

gallery.alt: Jorge practicing with his new prosthetic legs using parallel bars for support during rehabilitation
gallery.caption: Jorge taking his first steps with his new prosthetics during fitting

angels.name: Cleto
angels.story: Cleto was a below the knee amputee. He received his new prothesis in June 2022. We are so glad that we were able to help him take the next steps in his life both literally and figuratively.

details.Goals: Return to work and support family

gallery.alt: Cleto with AFL members and medical staff at the prosthetics clinic, using parallel bars for support
gallery.caption: Cleto's fitting session with our team

gallery.alt: Medical professional fitting Cleto's prosthetic leg while he sits in a wheelchair
gallery.caption: Detailed prosthetic fitting process
